intro: Dianthera laevilinguis, commonly known as the smooth-flowered dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains a relatively rare species in horticulture.
